About
Discover the Sebring Area, Florida’s Hidden Gem
The Heart of Florida…you will find Florida’s best-kept secrets, Sebring, Avon Park, and Lake Placid. Here in the center of the Sunshine State, you’ll find nearly 100 crystal clear lakes for fishing, boating, skiing, and sailing, and more than a dozen quality golf courses offering exceptional value. Our gently rolling hills, orange groves, and charming small towns make this a relaxing country getaway – and our central location provides easy access to Florida’s best attractions without the hustle and high prices of the major tourist areas. It’s the best of both worlds – within two hours of most major attractions yet removed enough to enjoy some relaxation. Come discover Highlands County for yourself!
Visit Sebring
Mission Statement
To contribute to a positive quality of life for the residents of Highlands County (our customer) through destination promotion, development, advocacy, and resource management.
What is Visit Sebring?
Visit Sebring serves as the official destination marketing and management organization for Highlands County, FL – home to the cities of Avon Park, Lake Placid, and Sebring. Through destination development and promoting the natural beauty, vibrant culture, and welcoming communities of the region, Visit Sebring aims to enhance the visitor experience while supporting local businesses and attractions. By showcasing the region’s unique charm and diverse offerings, we strive to attract travelers from near and far, encouraging them to explore all that the Sebring area has to offer. From the thrill of world-class racing to the serenity of its picturesque landscapes, the area promises unforgettable memories for every visitor. Whether you’re planning a family vacation, a relaxing getaway, or an adventurous escape, Visit Sebring is your gateway to discovering the hidden treasures of Highlands County in the heart of Florida.
Tourist Development Council (TDC)
Visit Sebring is the brand of the Highlands County Tourist Development Council (TDC). The TDC is a 9-member advisory committee to the Highlands County Board of County Commissioners. The TDC operates in accordance to Florida Statute 125.0104, serving as stewards of the Tourist Development Tax collected within Highlands County, FL.
Learn more about the tdc here
TDC Meetings
Click the arrows below for more information on TDC meetings.
2025 TDC Meeting Dates
January 30, 2025
May 1, 2025
August 7, 2025
October 30, 2025
The TDC meets quarterly in the County Commissioners’ Board Room in the Highlands County Government Center, 600 S. Commerce Ave., Sebring. Meetings begin at 8:15 a.m.
TDC Meeting Location & Time
Unless otherwise advertised, the TDC meetings in the County Commissioners’ Board Room in the Highlands County Government Center, 600 S. Commerce Ave., Sebring. Meetings begin at 8:15 a.m.
Agendas
TDC Meeting agendas are distributed via email the Friday prior to the meeting. To receive a copy of the agendas, email the TDC office at info@visitsebring.com.
Resources & Archive
minutes, recordings, studies, & more
Questions?
Contact TDC staff
Additional Information
What is the Tourist Development Tax?
The Tourist Development Tax (TDT) is a 5% tax on all transient accommodations in Sebring. You may also hear the TDT referred to as the Resort Tax, Bed Tax, Local Option Tourist Tax, Transient Rental Tax, etc. All of these terms refer to the 5% TDT tax, which is paid by tourists staying in the county for six (6) months or less.
Do I have to collect the Tourist Development Tax?
Your business is responsible for collecting and remitting this tax if you provide sleeping accommodations that are rented for six months or less (some exemptions apply), or if you have rentals longer than six months without a written lease.
For any questions on the Tourist Development Tax in Highlands County, use the
Contact
page to contact staff.
Event Marketing Grants
The TDC offers event grants as they recognize events and meetings as a major contributor to the overall tourism economy. These reimbursable funds are designated to promote Sebring as a preferred visitor destination and incentivize heads in beds through event hosting. To review the guidelines and application, please see the link below.
Event Grant Program

Santa Express – Steam Engine Holiday Train Rides
Multi-date Event:
DEBUG: Recurring detected
DEBUG: upcomingDates is_array: yes
DEBUG: upcomingDates count: 4
DEBUG: First few upcoming dates: 20251207, 20251219, 20251220
DEBUG: meta recurrence: specific_dates
Dec 7, 2025, Dec 19, 2025, Dec 20, 2025, Dec 21, 2025
Fireman's Feild
681 Magnolia Ave
Sebring, FL 33870
MORE INFO
: Santa Express – Steam Engine Holiday Train Rides
Overview
DEPARTING SEBRING
These joyful annual holiday trains have offered families a 2-hour trip through the countryside aboard a decorated, historic passenger train. Each ride features a visit with Santa Claus, cookies, and a commemorative gift. First-class tickets include locally-made sweets, treats, hot chocolate, and desserts. Multiple departures will be offered each day.
TICKETS
Our passenger train consists of historic cars dating from the early 1900s to the mid-1950s and includes first-class observation and lounge cars, table cars, deluxe coaches, and open-air cars. Our train is climate-controlled except in our open-air class and features restrooms onboard.
Tickets pricing varies from $60 – $300.
Tickets for most of the 2025-2026 season excursions go on sale September 3, 2025 at 6:00PM.
PARKING & BOARDING
Detailed parking and boarding instructions are emailed to you with your ticket confirmation.
NOTES
Due to its historic nature, Sugar Express is not ADA-accessible. The excursion cars feature steep steps, narrow hallways and doorways, and small restrooms, which may pose challenges for guests with limited mobility. Passengers with limited mobility need to be aware of these limitations and should expect such situations, and should
contact Sugar Express
for planning and accommodations
GROUPS
Host your own unforgettable excursion with Sugar Express. Full train charters are available for groups, organizations, or special occasions, offering exclusive use of our historic train and customizable experiences. Catering, bar service, and special amenities can be arranged to make your event truly unique.
Click here to
contact a ticket agent
.
To charter your own private, individual car for smaller groups, please view the options available on any publicly listed ticketing page.
For group bookings on any general excursion or public ride,
contact a ticket agent
.
More info & Tickets
Back to Events

Events
Upcoming Events in Highlands County
The Sebring area’s vibrant events calendar is a testament to its welcoming spirit and rich experiences it offers to all who visit. Whether you’re serving your need for speed at the races, participating in a lively festival, or simply enjoying a quiet day at a local market, each event is an opportunity to make cherished memories and discover the unique charm of this delightful region.
Signature Events
Whether you’re here for world-class racing, vibrant festivals, or family-friendly celebrations, Sebring’s signature events unite the community in a way that leaves a lasting impression.

Annual Events
Annual Events in Highlands County
If it’s a bubbly celebration of fizzy fun at the Sebring Soda Festival, a blooming good time at the Caladium Festival, or a thrilling day at the races at the 12 Hours of Sebring, the Sebring area offers a vibrant selection of annual events that capture the essence of this unique community. So, mark your calendar and join the festivities in Sebring, where every celebration is an invitation to experience the heart and soul of Central Florida.
Signature Events
Yesterday: A Tribute to The Beatles
Based in Las Vegas and endorsed by Sir Paul McCartney, “Yesterday: A Tribute to the Beatles” has over 25 years of experience paying tribute to the Fab Four performing in countless venues throughout the world. Spotlighting the Beatles’ entire career from the early days through the Sgt. Pepper album and beyond, the band goes to…

Back to Stories
Celebrate Halloween and Fall in Sebring: Events You Won’t Want to Miss!
As the Summer heat gives way to Florida’s very own version of Autumn, Sebring comes alive with festive celebrations. Whether you’re looking to peruse a pumpkin patch, don a costume, or enjoy some seasonal treats, there’s something for everyone this fall!
Terror Trail of Highlands County
– Voted one of the Top 10 haunts in Florida, the Terror Trail is an incredibly unique thriller attraction in Sebring, Florida made up of a 1/2 mile woodland path full of unsettling creatures, spooky set pieces, and innovative scares. Join the terrifying crew for opening weekend, September 27th and 28th and every Friday and Saturday in October from 7pm – 10pm. There is no specific age restriction for this event; however, it can be quite intense, so parental discretion is advised.
Pumpkin Patch Street Festival & Children’s Business Pop-Up
– Find your pick of the patch in the heart of Sebring! The Children’s Museum of Highlands County will be holding their 3rd annual Street Festival & Children’s Business Fair on October 20th from 12 pm – 5pm in Downtown Sebring. You’ll find family-fun games and activities, live music, some clowning around from Toby’s Junior Clown Show, free fall crafts for all ages, photos ops and pumpkins for sale, and discounted admission into the museum. And don’t miss shopping the pop-up vendor booths displaying businesses developed and run by local young minds of all ages!
Haunted Maze at the Historic Circle Theater
– Ready to get your scare on? Join the Greater Sebring Chamber of Commerce for some spine-chilling fun at their Annual Haunted Maze inside of the historic Circle Theatre! The Haunted Maze will be open October 25th from 5pm – 10pm and October 26 from 6 pm – 10pm. For those looking for a little less fright, there will be a Lights On entry on October 25th from 5pm – 6pm only.
Fall-O-Ween on the Circle
– Spooktacular times await at the Fall-O-Ween Halloween festival in Sebring’s Historic Circle Park on October 25th from 5:30pm – 9:00pm! Get ready for trunk or treat, face painting, games galore, toe-tapping music, a monster mash, and the adorable Lil Pumpkin Princess and Pumpkin Princess pageants, and more!
Avon Park Harvest Festival and Children’s Costume Parade
– Get ready for a fall extravaganza on Main Street in Downtown Avon Park! This year, they’re resurrecting a classic – the Avon Park Harvest Festival and Children’s Costume Parade! The parade kicks off at 3:00 PM and guess what? It’s totally free to strut your stuff! Stick around for a feast of live tunes, mouthwatering treats, lively vendor markets, and crafty creations galore!
Spring Lake Fall Festival
– If it’s a Florida Fall you’re looking for, you’ll want to venture to the Spring Lake neighborhood for a their annual Fall Festival held on October 26 from 10AM – 4PM! Plan to Eat, Shop & Play at the event! Set to be their largest festival yet, you can expect 100+ vendors, a variety of food trucks, their popular Farmers Market, special entertainment, and several games and inflatables to keep the young (and young-at-heart) entertained!
57th Annual Sebring Arts & Crafts Festival
– It’s a tradition! Join the Highlands Art League for the 57th Annual Sebring Arts & Crafts Festival in the charming Historic Circle Park of Downtown Sebring on November 2 from 10:00 AM – 4:00 PM! Get ready for an art extravaganza with vendors galore, delicious food, and a treasure trove of kid-friendly fun! Think face painting, dazzling beading, tablecloth masterpieces, sidewalk chalk art, and so much more! Get your creative juices flowing!
Pilgrim Palooza
– For one night only! The legendary dueling pianos from Howl at the Moon are storming the Historic Circle Theatre on November 16 from 6 PM to 11 PM. Get ready to boogie at the Turkey Tunes before and after party—it’s going to be a blast! This shindig is strictly 21+, so parents, it’s your time to kick back and unwind!
Sebring’s Gobble Wobble
– Get ready for a fantastic time at Sebring’s Gobble Wobble on November 23 from 1PM – 9PM in Downtown Sebring! Featuring a delightful array of handcrafted beer, wine, and spirits tastings from around the state, you’re bound to discover your new favorite drinks while enjoying live music that will keep the energy high and the atmosphere lively. Browse through a variety of unique vendors offering everything from artisan goods to tasty treats.
Turkey Trot 5K Walk/Run Races
– Don’t miss two opportunities to make room for Thanksgiving Day feasts with the
Sun ‘N Lake 5K Turkey Trot
on November 23 starting at 8AM and the
32nd Annual Thanksgiving Day Turkey Trot
in Highlands Hammock State Park on November 28 starting at 8AM.
With so many exciting events lined up, the Sebring area is the place to be this Fall! Be sure to check VisitSebring.com for the latest updates and details on all the festivities. Gather your friends and family, and experience the quaint, Autumnal charm of the Fall season in Sebring, Avon Park and Lake Placid!
